comments.body: Given the rest of the dependencies, I'm confused why X11 is needed?

We're currently using [polyscope](https://polyscope.run/) to handle the visualization of the trajectories in Mem3DG. I'm aware that there's a [polyscope feedstock](https://github.com/conda-forge/polyscope-feedstock) but afaik it doesn't bundle a linkable shared library and headers. We're using the c++ api to add options to the visualization so the python library isn't enough.

In the long run, I've been meaning to talk to @nmwsharp about packaging development versions of polyscope and geometry-central on conda-forge. For now, they're bundled in this application with licenses etc. until that happens.

I would be to have polyscope/geometry-central packaged on conda forge! And in the meantime bundling them like here is of course fine.

I'm still a conda forge novice---just barely figured out how to get that polyscope python feedstock up :)  However if you (or anyone else) can provide some pointers or submit a pull I'm all for it.
